Class CollisionRoom

  • java.lang.Object
    • CollisionRoom
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeficiencySchool

    public abstract class CollisionRoom
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Character character
      stores the reference of the character in the scene
      boolean[][] collisionGrid
      stores a grid of the map that the character is on (for collision detection) false - no collision true - collision collision detection takes the highest value that the character is "standing" on
      javafx.animation.AnimationTimer collisionTimer
      check collisions and movement of character using AnimationTimer
      boolean[] keyPressed
      stores which keys are being pressed
      int[][] promptGrid
      stores a grid of the map that the character is on (for user prompting) 0 - no prompt positive value - prompt prompt creates a text box that will tell the user what to do
      javafx.scene.Scene scene
      The scene for this application.
      javafx.stage.Stage stage
      The primary stage for this application.
      TextBox[] textBoxes
      what the textbox will display given the prompt
      int textBoxOpen
      stores the textbox that is being displayed, if any

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void buildRoom()
      builds the room using ${promptGrid} and ${collisionGrid}
      void fillCollisionGrid(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      fills the collision grid with true between ${x1} and ${x2} and ${y1} and ${y2}
      void fillPromptGrid(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int val)
      fills the prompt grid with ${val} between ${x1} and ${x2} and ${y1} and ${y2}
      int getPrompt()
      loops through the prompt grid and returns the highest value that the character is "standing" on
      boolean isColliding()
      returns if the character collides with the GUI
      abstract void setUpAnimationTimer()
      abstract method to set up AnimationTimer for the character in the room aka all the movement, collision detection, and scene changing logic
      void setUpUserInput()
      sets up getting user input for the scene

    • Method Detail

      • fillCollisionGrid

        public void fillCollisionGrid(int x1,
                              int y1,
                              int x2,
                              int y2)
        fills the collision grid with true between ${x1} and ${x2} and ${y1} and ${y2}
        Parameters:
        x1 - the starting x coordinate
        y1 - the starting y coordinate
        x2 - the ending x coordinate
        y2 - the ending y coordinate

      • fillPromptGrid

        public void fillPromptGrid(int x1,
                           int y1,
                           int x2,
                           int y2,
                           int val)
        fills the prompt grid with ${val} between ${x1} and ${x2} and ${y1} and ${y2}
        Parameters:
        x1 - the starting x coordinate
        y1 - the starting y coordinate
        x2 - the ending x coordinate
        y2 - the ending y coordinate
        val - the value to fill the grid with

      • isColliding

        public boolean isColliding()
        returns if the character collides with the GUI
        Returns:
        true if the character collides with the GUI

      • getPrompt

        public int getPrompt()
        loops through the prompt grid and returns the highest value that the character is "standing" on
        Returns:
        the prompt (if any) to display

      • buildRoom

        public abstract void buildRoom()
        builds the room using ${promptGrid} and ${collisionGrid}
